intro: Hieracium chandolygodes, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium chandolygodes is often found in open meadows and on slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
